function_arguments.summary: Niagara Falls Water Board seeks a qualified engineering consultant to perform Phase 1 sanitary sewer evaluation survey (SSES) services in the LaSalle area, deliver an engineering report and corrective action plan for inflow and infiltration (I&I) reduction, and conduct post-construction monitoring, with option pricing for Phases 2 and 3.

requirements.description: Perform all Phase 1 SSES tasks (Tasks 1–8) in the specified LaSalle sewersheds, including project management, smoke testing, flow isolation and measurement, CCTV/manhole report review, outfall/SSO condition assessment, focused SSES, reporting, and post-construction monitoring.
Identify a dedicated Project Manager as the primary contact for the project.
Review existing data, records, and reports including the Order on Consent and correspondence with NYSDEC regarding LaSalle SSO abatement.
Gain familiarity with Phase 1 sewersheds, their context in the sanitary system, and history of I&I reduction, repairs, maintenance, and SCADA-based flow management.
Meet with NFWB staff to discuss scope, understand system response in dry/wet weather, and get input on locations for flow isolation and measurement.
Provide ongoing consultation and professional advice to NFWB staff and meet with NFWB and NYSDEC as needed to reach consensus on work and corrective actions.
Provide all staff, equipment, and materials necessary to conduct smoke testing in Phase 1 sewersheds.
Notify residents 2–4 days before smoke testing with hand-delivered door hangers; assist NFWB in preparing a press release; coordinate notice to police and fire officials.
Conduct smoke testing only during appropriate weather conditions and document/photograph all defects revealed.
Review prior flow measurement and analysis for relevant sewersheds before performing night-time weiring for flow isolation and measurement.
Select adequate locations and number of weirs/measurements to allow complete and accurate infiltration analysis and targeted I&I corrective actions, in consultation with NFWB staff.

Provide all staff, equipment, and materials for flow isolation and measurement, including traffic control and confined space entry-trained staff and equipment; coordinate any needed sewer cleaning with NFWB crews.
Notify residents 2–4 days before disruptive flow isolation work with door hangers and assist NFWB in preparing a press release.
Analyze flow data and calculate infiltration in gallons per day per linear foot of sewer main for each weiring section.

Analyze and summarize available CCTV and manhole inspection reports (provided by NFWB) and identify any need for additional data collection; coordinate with NFWB on repairs already made and access to CCTV footage.

Review information on the two Phase 1 outfalls, conduct site visits to confirm conditions, and develop a Work Plan for Outfall/SSO condition assessment, including potential flow meters, rain gauges, confined space/dye testing, and coordination for CCTV.
Upon NFWB authorization, execute the Outfall/SSO Work Plan and document findings in GIS-compatible format with recommendations to reduce extraneous flows.

Be prepared to conduct focused SSES (dye testing, house inspections, additional CCTV via NFWB crews) to locate specific I&I sources or confirm findings, using a $10,000 contingency budget only with NFWB approval.

Prepare an SSES report for Phase 1 acceptable to NYSDEC, identifying I&I sources and a corrective action plan with most cost-effective flow reduction measures, including budgetary costs and implementation timelines.
Complete the SSES report in time to allow NYSDEC review early in 2023 so that construction can occur in 2023–early 2024 and post-construction monitoring can be completed by June 2024.

Ensure the SSES report is prepared, stamped, and dated by a New York State licensed Professional Engineer and conforms to the Engineering Report Outline for NYS Wastewater Infrastructure Projects dated October 1, 2022.

Conduct post-construction monitoring in 2024 (assuming 2023 construction) including assessment of pre- and post-construction flow and rainfall, and prepare a Post-Construction I&I Assessment and Cost Analysis Report for NYSDEC.
Provide option pricing, schedules, and fees for Phase 2 and Phase 3 SSES, applying applicable Phase 1 tasks and omitting Task 5 for Phase 2 (no outfalls).
Comply with all terms and conditions in Appendix E (standard terms, conditions, and requirements) unless exceptions are explicitly listed in a separate 'Exceptions' attachment.
Attend the mandatory pre-proposal information session at the Wastewater Treatment Plant on November 29, 2022 at noon.
Submit any written questions by the stated deadline to the authorized Water Board contact only, in compliance with NYS lobbying law and RFP communication restrictions.

Submit a proposal that includes, at minimum: situation understanding; understanding of regulations/standards; project approach/scope/organization; demonstrated experience on similar projects; experience/qualifications of subconsultants; specific experience of key professionals; and schedule/effort/budget breakdown with not-to-exceed fee and $10,000 contingency for Task 6.
Provide schedules in bar chart form and effort/budget in spreadsheet format using a task/hour estimate matrix with a not-to-exceed fee amount.

Complete and return all forms in Appendix E with the proposal, including Acknowledgement of Addenda, Certificate of Non-Collusion, Lobbying Law Disclosure Statement, EEO Policy Statement, Sexual Harassment Statement, and RFP Acknowledgement and Certification.

Submit MWBE and SDVOB utilization plans or properly completed waiver requests with the proposal, prior to contract execution, and comply with MWBE/SDVOB participation goals (30% MWBE combined and 6% SDVOB) and monthly reporting requirements.
Submit an EEO Staffing Plan and Workforce Employment Utilization Reports per the Mandatory State Financial Assistance Terms and Conditions.

Maintain required insurance coverages (Workers Compensation, Disability, Employer’s Liability, Commercial General Liability, Auto Liability, Umbrella/Excess, and Professional Liability) and name Niagara Falls Water Board, Niagara Falls Public Water Authority, and City of Niagara Falls as additional insureds on applicable policies.
Provide adequate and competent personnel with necessary licensing, education, training, and experience; comply with any NFWB credentialing, security, safety, or other requirements.

Develop and, if requested, submit a Safety Program and Site-Specific Health & Safety Plan that meet OSHA and federal/state/local requirements, including hazard analysis, PPE, training documentation, and monitoring plans.
Agree to indemnification and waiver of subrogation provisions in favor of NFWB and related entities.
Agree to maintain and provide access to complete and accurate records for at least six years after the calendar year in which they were made, in accordance with FOIL and audit requirements.
Comply with New York State Information Security Breach and Notification laws if handling any applicable data.
Pay prevailing wages as required by law and submit Workforce Employment Utilization Reports as required by Executive Law and Executive Order 162.
Provide monthly invoices with sufficient supporting documentation and comply with MWBE/SDVOB and prevailing wage requirements to receive payment within 60 days, subject to dispute resolution.
Certify non-discrimination and prohibition against sexual harassment; maintain a written sexual harassment prevention policy and provide annual training per NY Labor Law 201-g.

Certify compliance with Iran Divestment Act, international boycott prohibition, MacBride Principles, prohibition on purchase of tropical hardwoods, conflict of interest, non-collusion, and other statutory certifications.
Acknowledge NFWB rights regarding proposal evaluation, contract award, negotiations, termination for cause/convenience, and governing law/venue in New York.

Proposal must include a detailed Statement of Qualifications, including business structure, licensing, years in business, similar project experience with references, key personnel, and disclosure of names, subsidiaries, debarment/default history, bankruptcies, legal actions, conflicts of interest, and planned subcontractors performing more than 10% of work.

Deliver one clearly marked original and six copies of the proposal plus one electronic copy (CD or USB) as a single PDF (or logically ordered files), by the deadline, in a sealed outer envelope labeled with proposer name, address, RFP number, and title, delivered to the contact/location on the cover page.
Acknowledge receipt (or non-receipt) of all RFP addenda using Appendix E Form No. 1.
Agree to restrictions on communications during the Restricted Period and complete Lobbying Law Disclosure Statement (Appendix E Form No. 3).
Comply with MWBE/SDVOB monthly reporting using the Monthly MWBE-SDVOB Contractor Compliance Report and provide proof of timely payments to subcontractors.
Ensure no suspended/debarred entities (per NY Labor Law §220-b and Executive Law §316) are used as contractors or subcontractors.
Demonstrate understanding and ability to work within the context of the Order on Consent R9020080528-32, the revised work schedule, and sewershed prioritization methodology (R-value).
Document outfall locations 013, 014, and 017 and their relevance to Phase 1 and Phase 3 sewersheds in assessments and reporting.

evaluation_criteria.description: Demonstrated understanding of the LaSalle SSO context, Order on Consent, sewershed prioritization, I&I issues, and project objectives.
Relevant experience on similar SSES/I&I/SSO projects, qualifications of key staff and subconsultants, and organizational capabilities.
Degree to which the proposal addresses all RFP requirements, includes all required forms and sections, and presents clear schedules and budgets.
Competitiveness and clarity of the not-to-exceed fee for Phase 1 and option pricing for Phases 2 and 3, relative to scope and value offered.

submission_requirements.format: One original and six hard copies plus one electronic copy (CD or USB) in PDF or equivalent, sealed and labeled envelope delivered to the NFWB authorized contact/location.
sections_required: Understanding of applicable regulations and standards
Project approach, scope, and project organization
Specific experience of key project professionals
Schedule, effort and budget breakdown (bar chart schedule; task/hour estimate matrix; not-to-exceed fee; $10,000 contingency for Task 6)
MWBE and SDVOB utilization plans or waiver requests
Options for Phase 2 and Phase 3 (schedule and fees)

key_differentiators: Deep, demonstrated experience with sanitary sewer evaluation surveys, I&I mitigation, SSO abatement, and NYSDEC/EPG-funded wastewater infrastructure projects, including familiarity with the Engineering Report Outline dated October 1, 2022.
Clear situational understanding of the LaSalle sewersheds, Order on Consent, R-value methodology, and phased approach, articulated in the proposal’s situation understanding section.

A robust, well-sequenced technical approach that not only meets but exceeds the minimum tasks (e.g., advanced data analytics, GIS integration, risk-based prioritization of corrective actions, enhanced public communication strategies).
Strong NY-licensed PE leadership and a multidisciplinary team with proven ability to deliver NYSDEC-acceptable engineering reports and to coordinate effectively with regulators.
A credible schedule that aligns with NYSDEC review, 2023–early 2024 construction, and completion of post-construction monitoring by June 2024, backed by realistic staffing and contingency planning.
Competitive, transparent not-to-exceed pricing with clear task/hour breakdowns and well-justified option pricing for Phases 2 and 3.
Proactive, compliant MWBE and SDVOB utilization strategy that credibly meets or exceeds the 30% MWBE and 6% SDVOB goals, supported by identified certified partners and a clear reporting process.
Demonstrated ability to manage safety, confined space entry, traffic control, and community relations (resident notifications, coordination with emergency services) effectively.
Strong contract compliance posture, including all required certifications, insurance, FOIL-aware documentation practices, and understanding of NFWB’s standard terms and termination rights.

evaluation_criteria=[EvaluationCriterion(criterion='Situational understanding', weight=20.0, description='Demonstrated understanding of the LaSalle SSO context, Order on Consent, sewershed prioritization, I&I issues, and project objectives.'), EvaluationCriterion(criterion='Demonstrated experience, capabilities, and qualifications', weight=40.0, description='Relevant experience on similar SSES/I&I/SSO projects, qualifications of key staff and subconsultants, and organizational capabilities.'), EvaluationCriterion(criterion='Completeness of the proposal', weight=20.0, description='Degree to which the proposal addresses all RFP requirements, includes all required forms and sections, and presents clear schedules and budgets.'), EvaluationCriterion(criterion='Total proposed cost', weight=20.0, description='Competitiveness and clarity of the not-to-exceed fee for Phase 1 and option pricing for Phases 2 and 3, relative to scope and value offered.')] submission_requirements=SubmissionRequirements(deadline='Monday, December 5, 2022 by 2:00 p.m.', format='One original and six hard copies plus one electronic copy (CD or USB) in PDF or equivalent, sealed and labeled envelope delivered to the NFWB authorized contact/location.', page_limit=None, sections_required=['Situation understanding', 'Understanding of applicable regulations and standards', 'Project approach, scope, and project organization', 'Demonstrated experience on similar projects', 'Experience & qualifications of subconsultants/contractors', 'Specific experience of key project professionals', 'Schedule, effort and budget breakdown (bar chart schedule; task/hour estimate matrix; not-to-exceed fee; $10,000 contingency for Task 6)', 'Completed Appendix E forms', 'MWBE and SDVOB utilization plans or waiver requests', 'Options for Phase 2 and Phase 3 (schedule and fees)']) key_differentiators=['Deep, demonstrated experience with sanitary sewer evaluation surveys, I&I mitigation, SSO abatement, and NYSDEC/EPG-funded wastewater infrastructure projects, including familiarity with the Engineering Report Outline dated October 1, 2022.', 'Clear situational understanding of the LaSalle sewersheds, Order on Consent, R-value methodology, and phased approach, articulated in the proposal’s situation understanding section.', 'A robust, well-sequenced technical approach that not only meets but exceeds the minimum tasks (e.g., advanced data analytics, GIS integration, risk-based prioritization of corrective actions, enhanced public communication strategies).', 'Strong NY-licensed PE leadership and a multidisciplinary team with proven ability to deliver NYSDEC-acceptable engineering reports and to coordinate effectively with regulators.', 'A credible schedule that aligns with NYSDEC review, 2023–early 2024 construction, and completion of post-construction monitoring by June 2024, backed by realistic staffing and contingency planning.', 'Competitive, transparent not-to-exceed pricing with clear task/hour breakdowns and well-justified option pricing for Phases 2 and 3.', 'Proactive, compliant MWBE and SDVOB utilization strategy that credibly meets or exceeds the 30% MWBE and 6% SDVOB goals, supported by identified certified partners and a clear reporting process.', 'Demonstrated ability to manage safety, confined space entry, traffic control, and community relations (resident notifications, coordination with emergency services) effectively.', 'Strong contract compliance posture, including all required certifications, insurance, FOIL-aware documentation practices, and understanding of NFWB’s standard terms and termination rights.']
